author: Prakash Kamat
text:
The Animal Welfare Board of India (AWBI) has advised the Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change (MEF&CC) not to allow jallikattu, which the Supreme Court as ruled as illegal

Immediately after People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals (PETA) India complained about a recent statement made by Prakash Javadekar, the Minister of EF&CC, promising to allow jallikattu, the AWBI advised the Ministry against doing any such thing.

The AWBI’s opinion with respect to events such as jallikattu, bullock carts races, kambala, remains unchanged: they are illegal.
title: AWBI urges Centre not to allow jallikattu
